title: Evaluating Sources
description:
Join our workshop to learn the art of evaluating sources. Learn to discern credible sources, spot bias, and assess relevance. Gain critical thinking skills vital for academic success and informed decision-making. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14379752

title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: Mindfulness Meditation
description:
Online. Mindfulness Meditation is the practice of being self-aware with an extra focus on your breath. Open to all who are interested in learning about meditation and developing mindfulness in daily life. Participate with video or audio only. 
 **Please note that we cannot verify attendance at this event

title: Residence Hall Association (RHA) Hangout
description:
🎬📺  Love TV Shows? Movies? Campus Strolls?  Let’s talk about it! Join the  Residence Hall Association  for a chill and fun  Hangout  where we’ll dive into our favorite shows, movies, and everything we love (or love to hate) about campus life. Whether you're into deep discussions or just want to vibe, this is the spot for you! 
 📍 Dinallo MPR 🗓️  Monday, April 28, 2025 🕐  1:00 PM – 2:00 PM 
 All students are welcome! Commuters are invited too but must be signed in by a resident following  Residence Life guest registration procedures. 
 Come through for the convos, stay for the good vibes!

title: Adopt A Succulent
description: Join the Office of Commuter Life in our Adopt A Succulent Event where you’ll have the chance to take home your very own plant & decorate your pot!

title: Gathering Your Sources
description:
Gathering resources for a research project can seem like a challenge: there are so many variables to consider. This workshop will look at the criteria that should guide your selection of sources.  But it will largely be a tutorial on database searching – for both scholarly articles and books. Moreover, we will look at the relationship between selecting sources and refining a research topic.  I hope you can join us. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14409019

title: Residence Hall Association E-Board Recruitment!
description: Are you looking for student leadership opportunities? Do you plan on living on campus during the 2025 - 2026 Academic School Year? Join the Executive Board of the Residence Hall Association of Montclair State University!

title: She Speaks: Empowerment, Innovation, and Leadership
description: Join us for an inspiring panel, where dynamic leaders and innovators will share their journeys and insights on navigating challenges, breaking barriers, and shaping the future. Whether you’re looking for motivation, mentorship, or just a powerful conversation, this event is designed to uplift and empower women from all walks of life. Don’t miss the chance to connect, learn, and be inspired!

title: Ramen Night
description:
🍜  Ramen Night  🍥 Slurp, savor, and enjoy the warmth of good company. 
 Warm up your taste buds and join us for an unforgettable  Ramen Night ! From classic broths to creative toppings, we’ve got everything you need for a comforting, delicious evening. 
 🍲 Build your own ramen bowl with endless toppings 🍥 Flavorful broths, noodles, and proteins 🥢 Vegetarian & vegan options available 🍚 Free snacks and good vibes all night 
 Come hungry, and bring your appetite for noodles! 
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Pizza and Bingo
description:
🍕  Pizza & Bingo Night  🎉 Eat pizza, win prizes, and have a blast! 
 Get ready for the perfect combo of pizza, prizes, and fun at  Pizza & Bingo Night ! Grab a slice, mark your card, and get ready to shout “Bingo!” as you play for awesome prizes and enjoy some good food. 
 🍕 Delicious pizza  🎲 Fun, fast-paced bingo games with great prizes 🎉 Good vibes and a chance to win! 
 Come for the pizza, stay for the prizes! 
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

Online. Mindfulness Meditation is the practice of being self-aware with an extra focus on your breath. Open to all who are interested in learning about meditation and developing mindfulness in daily life. Participate with video or audio only. 
 **Please note that we cannot verify attendance at this event

title: Residence Hall Association (RHA) Hangout
description:
🎬📺  Love TV Shows? Movies? Campus Strolls?  Let’s talk about it! Join the  Residence Hall Association  for a chill and fun  Hangout  where we’ll dive into our favorite shows, movies, and everything we love (or love to hate) about campus life. Whether you're into deep discussions or just want to vibe, this is the spot for you! 
 📍 Dinallo MPR 🗓️  Monday, April 28, 2025 🕐  1:00 PM – 2:00 PM 
 All students are welcome! Commuters are invited too but must be signed in by a resident following  Residence Life guest registration procedures. 
 Come through for the convos, stay for the good vibes!

title: Adopt A Succulent
description: Join the Office of Commuter Life in our Adopt A Succulent Event where you’ll have the chance to take home your very own plant & decorate your pot!

title: Gathering Your Sources
description:
Gathering resources for a research project can seem like a challenge: there are so many variables to consider. This workshop will look at the criteria that should guide your selection of sources.  But it will largely be a tutorial on database searching – for both scholarly articles and books. Moreover, we will look at the relationship between selecting sources and refining a research topic.  I hope you can join us. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14409019

title: Residence Hall Association E-Board Recruitment!
description: Are you looking for student leadership opportunities? Do you plan on living on campus during the 2025 - 2026 Academic School Year? Join the Executive Board of the Residence Hall Association of Montclair State University!

title: She Speaks: Empowerment, Innovation, and Leadership
description: Join us for an inspiring panel, where dynamic leaders and innovators will share their journeys and insights on navigating challenges, breaking barriers, and shaping the future. Whether you’re looking for motivation, mentorship, or just a powerful conversation, this event is designed to uplift and empower women from all walks of life. Don’t miss the chance to connect, learn, and be inspired!

title: Ramen Night
description:
🍜  Ramen Night  🍥 Slurp, savor, and enjoy the warmth of good company. 
 Warm up your taste buds and join us for an unforgettable  Ramen Night ! From classic broths to creative toppings, we’ve got everything you need for a comforting, delicious evening. 
 🍲 Build your own ramen bowl with endless toppings 🍥 Flavorful broths, noodles, and proteins 🥢 Vegetarian & vegan options available 🍚 Free snacks and good vibes all night 
 Come hungry, and bring your appetite for noodles! 
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Pizza and Bingo
description:
🍕  Pizza & Bingo Night  🎉 Eat pizza, win prizes, and have a blast! 
 Get ready for the perfect combo of pizza, prizes, and fun at  Pizza & Bingo Night ! Grab a slice, mark your card, and get ready to shout “Bingo!” as you play for awesome prizes and enjoy some good food. 
 🍕 Delicious pizza  🎲 Fun, fast-paced bingo games with great prizes 🎉 Good vibes and a chance to win! 
 Come for the pizza, stay for the prizes! 
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Evaluating Sources
description:
Join our workshop to learn the art of evaluating sources. Learn to discern credible sources, spot bias, and assess relevance. Gain critical thinking skills vital for academic success and informed decision-making. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14379752

title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: Ramen Night
description:
🍜  Ramen Night  🍥 Slurp, savor, and enjoy the warmth of good company. 
 Warm up your taste buds and join us for an unforgettable  Ramen Night ! From classic broths to creative toppings, we’ve got everything you need for a comforting, delicious evening. 
 🍲 Build your own ramen bowl with endless toppings 🍥 Flavorful broths, noodles, and proteins 🥢 Vegetarian & vegan options available 🍚 Free snacks and good vibes all night 
 Come hungry, and bring your appetite for noodles! 
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Pizza and Bingo
description:
🍕  Pizza & Bingo Night  🎉 Eat pizza, win prizes, and have a blast! 
 Get ready for the perfect combo of pizza, prizes, and fun at  Pizza & Bingo Night ! Grab a slice, mark your card, and get ready to shout “Bingo!” as you play for awesome prizes and enjoy some good food. 
 🍕 Delicious pizza  🎲 Fun, fast-paced bingo games with great prizes 🎉 Good vibes and a chance to win! 
 Come for the pizza, stay for the prizes! 
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Evaluating Sources
description:
Join our workshop to learn the art of evaluating sources. Learn to discern credible sources, spot bias, and assess relevance. Gain critical thinking skills vital for academic success and informed decision-making. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14379752

title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: Mindfulness Meditation
description:
Online. Mindfulness Meditation is the practice of being self-aware with an extra focus on your breath. Open to all who are interested in learning about meditation and developing mindfulness in daily life. Participate with video or audio only. 
 **Please note that we cannot verify attendance at this event

title: Residence Hall Association (RHA) Hangout
description:
🎬📺  Love TV Shows? Movies? Campus Strolls?  Let’s talk about it! Join the  Residence Hall Association  for a chill and fun  Hangout  where we’ll dive into our favorite shows, movies, and everything we love (or love to hate) about campus life. Whether you're into deep discussions or just want to vibe, this is the spot for you! 
 📍 Dinallo MPR 🗓️  Monday, April 28, 2025 🕐  1:00 PM – 2:00 PM 
 All students are welcome! Commuters are invited too but must be signed in by a resident following  Residence Life guest registration procedures. 
 Come through for the convos, stay for the good vibes!

title: Adopt A Succulent
description: Join the Office of Commuter Life in our Adopt A Succulent Event where you’ll have the chance to take home your very own plant & decorate your pot!

title: Gathering Your Sources
description:
Gathering resources for a research project can seem like a challenge: there are so many variables to consider. This workshop will look at the criteria that should guide your selection of sources.  But it will largely be a tutorial on database searching – for both scholarly articles and books. Moreover, we will look at the relationship between selecting sources and refining a research topic.  I hope you can join us. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14409019

 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: Adopt A Succulent
description: Join the Office of Commuter Life in our Adopt A Succulent Event where you’ll have the chance to take home your very own plant & decorate your pot!

title: Gathering Your Sources
description:
Gathering resources for a research project can seem like a challenge: there are so many variables to consider. This workshop will look at the criteria that should guide your selection of sources.  But it will largely be a tutorial on database searching – for both scholarly articles and books. Moreover, we will look at the relationship between selecting sources and refining a research topic.  I hope you can join us. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14409019
